review: When Amazon designed Fire TV, it did so by addressing the weaknesses highlighted in reviews of competing products, so it goes.At the time, complaints were about speed, UI and search. This box is fast, it looks pretty (although cannot be customized) and the voice search works beautifully. But the world has moved on.Content is king, and navigation is Queen. With network and cable operators offering apps for streaming content via Watch ABC, FOXNOW, and others, it's simply easier for me to watch what I want to on a different platform. For services that are on Fire TV (Netflix, Hulu, HBO Go) accessing non-Amazon content requires you to go out of your way. The application isn't in your "Recent" list? You have to scroll down to "Apps", sideways through a carousel, and then navigate within the application.What would take 3-4 clicks on a Roku or Apple TV can take 12-15 on Fire TV. It almost feels like being punished for not buying the content directly from Amazon. If non-Amazon content were better integrated and easier to navigate, I would use my Fire TV more often and therefore spend more money in Amazon's ecosystem.The box sits under my TV waiting to be useful. If a few things change, I would happily toss out my Roku.1. Integrate shows/movies from third party services in the recently used carousel. It makes no sense that an Amazon-purchased movie is given parity with the Netflix or Hulu apps.2. Work to add more content providers. Watch ABC, FOXNOW, etc. could easily be ported.3. Allow me to customize the view. It shouldn't take me 45 seconds to find HBO Go.I really want to like my Fire TV, because there is so much potential. But the gains in speed and discovery of Amazon content are offset by a clunky interface and limited offerings when compared with competitors.

review: Great performance, high quality, hi def video.... Handicapped by no easy way to view all the videos available. Certainly you can see some of the latest but this library of thousands and thousands of videos is not given in a aggregated visual library that I have been able to find.Its easy enough to do a voice search but if you dont know the specifics or are trying to randomly search for something new you might as well give it up. Yes, I would buy it again and I will keep the service but it makes me wonder why have something with such great hardware that is gimped by such poor presentation of the overall library of free video in a visual format.
